block.p: Magazines remain a healthy place for advertising, with growth everywhere except for the home furnishings and financial, insurance and real estate categories, which reflects the downturn in housing starts and home sales.

Direct-to-consumer ad campaigns remain a strong vehicle for pharmaceutical companies, and the drug category led the field with 15.8 percent growth from 2006. Even in those categories where the number of advertising pages fell -- food, apparel and technology -- there was an increase in revenue.
